title: How did explorers use stars to navigate? - Quora

response.answer_text: Most common star which was used to know the direction is Polaris. Because Polaris never changes it’s position throughout the night, it’s always in the north. To locate the Polaris, Ursa Major (Big Dipper) or Cassiopeia constellations are used. The first two stars of big dipper and middle star of cassiopeia always points towards Polaris.
